wikipedia_page.main: Sir John Henry Gladstone Leahy,  (7 February 1928 – 17 November 2015) was a senior British diplomat. He was Ambassador to South Africa from 1979 to 1982, and High Commissioner to Australia from 1984 to 1988. He later became Chairman of Lonrho.

response: *2015 – John Leahy, English lawyer and diplomat, High Commissioner to Australia (b. 1928)

response: * John Leahy  (executive) (born 1950), American businessman, executive at Airbus

In April 1984, Thatcher sent senior British diplomat, Sir John Leahy, to negotiate the release of 16 Britons who had been taken hostage by the Angolan rebel leader, Jonas Savimbi. At the time, Savimbi's UNITA guerrilla movement was financed and supported militarily by the apartheid regime of South Africa. On 26 April 1984 Leahy succeeded in securing the release of the British hostages at the UNITA base in Jamba, Cuando Cubango, Angola.
* Sir John Leahy, KCMG, British Ambassador to South Africa
John Leahy is the name of:
* John Leahy (Australian politician) (1854–1909), Australian Conservative politician, 1893–1909
* John Leahy (Irish politician), Leader of Renua Ireland
* John Leahy (diplomat) (1928–2015), former senior British diplomat
* John Leahy (executive) (born 1950), American executive at Airbus
